"So who is this guy, Freeman?
They say he was at ground zero.
Science team? You think he was responsible? Sabotage, maybe?
Yeah, maybe. All I know for sure is he's been killing my buddies.
Oh yeah, he'll pay. He will definitely pay."

That, is some great world building. 10/10, Valve classic.
A 20+ year old game that still out-does many titles today.
A good game that has a lot of bad parts. Its aged like an old car, lacking many newer features and overall being harder to drive but still fun to drive.

I'm composing this the second I completed the game. I got it on Christmas, and I completed it seven days after the fact after work. It was anything but a dreary game by any means. I'm truly astounded that 7 hours of interactivity felt like it was significantly longer. I guess this is a direct result of the way that it was a totally different encounter for me, and I would accept that the another playthrough will feel fast.

I'm in wonder. I'm past dazzled with Half-Life. For a game that delivered in 1999, for a game that is more established than me, for a game that was plainly the best unrest in FPS games since Destruction and Tremor, I'm totally flabbergasted by the experience.
Timeless clasic ! A mastercraft for anyone who wants to experience a game like this !
It's Half Life, what more do I have to say? An absolute classic that you will definitely enjoy.
